channel.title: [WIP] Social Networking Site [+Source]
channel.description:
Hey guys, I know I haven't posted in awhile, but I figured this is interesting enough to be posted here, at least for the open source part of it, so some of you can maybe learn something, or help me learn more. Here is the link: http://www.chatshack.us/chatspace.php (un-original name, I know)
This site is a work-in-progress social networking site designed by Mastrchief(Chris_) for the purpose of giving online users something other than myspace or facebook to communicate with friends and meet new people. I will constantly be working on this, so expect plenty of updates, and if you have a question, comment, or concern, please feel free to notify me either here or anywhere else you know you can get contact with me. For those of you wanting to see the source script, I have it uploaded here. Enjoy it, and learn from it.
Now, as I've said, this is an open source project, so you can find the source [url=http://www.chatshack.us/chatspace.txt]here[/url]. I update it frequently, so you're never left out on changes. This was originally just so I could potentially learn something new, but as I show it to people, they say it has potential for more than just a weekend project. If anybody would like to be "beta" testers for new updates, I would appreciate the help, and credit will be given where credit is due. Comments, criticism, etc, all accepted. Please note, I'm working on functionality before I start with visuals. If you sign up with the intent to be a faggot, you will be banned.

item.title: [WIP] Social Networking Site [+Source]
item.dc:creator: @MastrChief MastrChief
item.description:
@MastrChief wrote:

Sorry, internet has been out for awhile so I haven’t been able to respond.

error.login:

any i pmed you about?

I’m actually looking into these:

http://www.bihira.com/products
http://www.bluehost.com/tell_me_more.html
http://www.webhostingbuzz.com/website-hosting.shtml?host_reseller-hosting

Kollidierende:

For the Visual Page Editing are you going to be making your very own WYSIWYG editor?

I don’t really like WYSIWYG editors but I guess I could give it a try.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 11, 2008, 12:25:31 AM[/size][hr]I’m working on learning as much css as I can to make this project prettier, but I was wondering if anyone would like to tip me on how to limit how many values are shown on a page.

What I am trying to say is, say you have 25 inbox messages…

Page 1 will have the latest 10
Page 2 will have the next most recent 10
Page 3 will have the last 5

All help is appreciated

Read full topic

item.title: [WIP] Social Networking Site [+Source]
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“MastrChief, post:21, topic:173457”]A small hint as to how I would do a friend table other than

Table Friends
User etc
Friends etc
(‘Mastrchief’, ‘Name1|Name2|Name3|Name4’)

$Get_Friends = mysql_query(“SELECT Friends FROMFriends`”);
$Friends = explode(’|’, $Get_Friends);

etc. Just doesn’t seem very efficient.[/quote]
you can try dumping a serialized array into friends.friends, for example:
[php]$friends = array(“sppt”, “mopar”, “masterchief”);
$friends = serialize($friends);
//INSERT INTO friends SET friends=’$friends’
[/php]
then, when you want to retrieve the friends, do something like this:
[php]
//fetch the data from the db
$friends = unserialize($result[‘friends’]);
[/php]

hope this helps

Read full topic

item.title: [WIP] Social Networking Site [+Source]
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“MastrChief, post:11, topic:173457”][quote author=Uriko link=topic=233761.msg1999147#msg1999147 date=1200461555]
Please, don’t keep it all on one file, that’s ugly as fuck. Separate it up, include headers, footers, make it neat!
[/quote]

Since I’m only in the beginning stages, I will leave it as is, but once I get all the important things done, I will make things neater.

[quote author=Uriko link=topic=233761.msg1999147#msg1999147 date=1200461555](I was actually considering developing one, please don’t think I’m going to take your code and use it, I’ll be developing with a friend.)
[/quote]

I wouldn’t be concerned if you did, thats why I made it an open source project.[/quote]

Yeah, but if you want others to work on it too you should make it neater so others can understand it easier.

Read full topic
